Title: Introduction and what you'll need for criminal and compliance checks on your organisation

Pages.Title: Criminal and compliance checks on your organisation
Pages.LinkTitle: Criminal and compliance checks on your organisation
Pages.BodyText:
This section is to ensure public funds, employers and apprentices are protected.

All organisations applying to join the RoATP are subject to the Funding higher risk organisations and subcontractors policy (opens in new tab).

You'll need to provide a brief summary if your organisation has:

  • composition with creditors
  • failed to pay back funds to ESFA or any other public body
  • had a contract terminated by a public body
  • had early withdrawal from a contract with a public body
  • been removed from the Register of Training Organisations (RoTO)
  • had funds removed from any education bodies
  • been removed from any professional or trade registers
  • had involuntary withdrawal from Initial Teacher Training accreditation
  • been removed from any charity register
  • been investigated due to safeguarding issues
  • been investigated due to whistleblowing issues
  • been made bankrupt
